event,"



A man walks into a drug store with his 8-year old son. They happen to walk by the condom display, and the boy asks,""What are these, Dad?""
To which the man matter-of-factly replies, ""Those are called condoms, son. Men use them to have safe sex.""
Oh I see,"" replied the boy pensively. Yes, I've heard of that in health class at school.""

He looks over the display and picks up a package of 3 and asks, ""Why are there 3 in this package? "" The dad replies,""Those are for high school boys, ONE for Friday, ONE for Saturday, and ONE for Sunday."" ""Cool"" says the boy.
He notices a 6 pack and asks, ""Then who are these for?"" ""Those are for college men,"" the dad answers, TWO for Friday, TWO for Saturday, and TWO for Sunday.""
WOW!"" exclaimed the boy, ""then who uses THESE?"" he asks, picking up a 12 pack!
With a sigh and a tear in his eye, the dad replied, ""Those are for the married men. ONE for January, ONE for February, ONE for March....etc.""

event,"


Dad is coming back on Monday =).....Brother is leaving for CT soon.....=(



"
Over the weekend my family received news from Vietnam that my grandpa, who was in his eighties, passed away......

My dad along with seven of his brothers and sisters flew back for the funeral the same night.  My uncle said that upon arriving at my grandparents' house, where my grandpa's body was lying until the funeral, my dad couldn't stop crying. Throughout my entire life, I have never seen my dad shed a single tear.  It shows how much my grandpa meant to him...
GRRRrrrr.....so tired and sleepy but I gotta do homeworks and study for a billion midterms!! Can't wait until it is all over, and when it happens, this will be me....

Just made lasagna for dinner, but dunno how its gonna taste.  Hope it is good.  I'm hungry.  Hope to eat soon.  Have a headache.  Hope it will go away.  Boyfriend.  Hope he will stop being mean to me and calling me fat cuz I eat too many hotdogs.  Alritie, toodles =)"

event,"I'm proud of myself because I have been attending every single class since school started.  Unfortunately, I will soon be bombarded with midterms and will no longer have a life.  So until then, I've been enjoying my days by playing pool.  It's so addicting, even Bobby started playing too...except the beefalo plays using a ruler...and still misses =P.  I can't stop making fun of him...I'm sowwies!! =P

Other than pool, the fishies have been keeping us very entertained.  Chibo's black fish has an eating disorder...umm, the kind where it can't stop eating.  And you know what comes in must find its way out....Poor fish was swimming around with a long strand of...stuff...hanging from its bootie. Bobby's fish and my fish apparently likes to nibble on that long strand from Chibo's bootie....all I can say is EWWWWWWWWWW!!!!!!!  My fish took in the whole strand!....sooooo disgusting....good thing it spat it back out. =/  Hong and Rami's fishies are very territorial.  They like to pick on the other fishies, chasing them around, etc.  Hopefully they'll all get along well, live happily in the fish tank, eat lots of food, grow very big so I can eat them =P umm..j/k about that last part hehehehe......"

column1: event,"I'm at hooome.  It's 4 am and I'm not even sleepy anymore.  Nobody online and I'm bored so perfect time to update! Haha...as u can tell the last update was not written by me (fully =P) haha.
My laptop sucks, I accidentally pulled the power plug and it completely shut off. No battery life whatsoever.  BUT! As soon as I signed back on, I see Chibo online!! =) Such odd hours haha.

So I've moved into another apartment and although I miss my old housemates, my new housemates are awesome =).  Random silliness, eating together at odd hours, etc haha.  I cleaned up the big mess I made.  Bought a new desk, bookcase, storage stuff, etc and the room now looks complete.  Rami helped me put together my entire desk and bookcase, thank you soooo much! (Thanks to Chibo also =P) The whole time we were pounding nails, Hong was dead asleep. She is such a workaholic, she even dreams about work!  But yeah, Chibo and I are pretty good at rearranging and organizing rooms, wanna hire us to do yours??? =P hahaha j/k."

column1: event,"Even the smallest gestures can make me smile when I'm feeling really sad."

event,"Just turned in my take home English final and boy do I feel relieved...no essay, just correct some grammar and done! =) That was by far my easiest final ever (something I can't say about my NPB final earlier this morning =/ Although I can say - ->  #@*% you NPB !!!)

Should go pack and drive home but that would just be insane driving during traffic hour and no carpool.  Why can't I just set my Badass or my Stewie doll in the passenger seat and claim carpool??? =P  Speaking of which, I never got to show off my Stewie doll that Bobby surprised me with! Talk about a pissed off little man haha......

Should go pack some stuff to take home now.  Gonna take home stuff I don't need in Davis so I have less to move later on. I have a crapload of stuff to pack before moving out at the end of this month.  Can't believe I'll have only 3 weeks left here.  We've had our shares of ups and downs in this house, but I know I will miss Club2012 for all of its great moments.  The fun times we've had with cooking festive meals for the holidays haha, our crazy parties, late night walks, house trip to san francisco, driving through creepy road to get to the beach late at night, and so much more.  The stupid things we've done like lighting towels on fire...(ok, that was just me =P ), defrosting shrimp by throwing it down the back patio, feeding jello to fellow housemates by dropping it from the loft and into their mouths, targetting loretta's window across the parking lot with ""grape canons"", the raining bras, the scandalous lingerie posters, the boobie balloons, the yelling, the screaming, the laughing, the moaning heard by unexpected visitors (like Tamo), the educational sex talks, the sex....haha just kidding about that last one! =P...*sigh*...I will miss you girls a lot..."

event,"I wanna sleep but after every long talk I have a lot on my mind, so here I will ramble to let it out.  I think about things, everything, and question why did this happen, what am I gonna do, who is it gonna affect....without having any real answers.  What do you do when some little thing bugs the crap out of you? What do you do when you can't fix certain things?  What do you do when you know you're being stupid/jealous/selfish but you can't help it? What do you do when you want to forget it and move on, but it keeps coming back to poke you in the heart?  I wish I knew, but I don't....I'm sorry, I really don't....."

event,"It's THURSDAY and that means I get to go home! =) ...even though its the weekend before finals =P.  Woops....was gonna update but Bobby's coming over to pick us up now so I'll update later hehe

Yay! At home now =).  Been eating mucho again hahaha.  Today Bobby and I went to Kim Wong and her friends' bbq at Santa Clara Central Park...wow, it's such a big park.  There's everything there, bbq area, tennis courts, baseball field, little stadium, even a big swimming pool.  We ates lots but I still wasn't satisfied so on our way home we stopped by Euro Delights Bakery...that place has the prettiest cakes and other desserts =).  That's also the place where I got Kim Nguyen's bday cake.  So I couldn't help myself and picked up coffee mousse cakes, tiramisu cake, mango moussse cake, and even pickled mangoes hehehe =).  Bobby was like ""geez, how many cakes are u getting, piggie!"" and the sales lady looked at me and smirked.  Haha, I don't deny, I am a piggie =P cuz I came home and ate some more during dinner with my parents!!
Tomorrow I'm going on a date with Phan...lunch date haha (more food =P).  Hopefully I'll study a bit before I head back to Davis on Sunday cuz it's gonna be crazy next week.

My roomie Kim Wong is also moving out next week!! =(  She's also gonna leave the country for a while...I'm gonna miss her, she was a reallly great roommate and friend =).  Now bring me back some souveniers!!! hahaha j/k =P.  Hope you have a blast over there!"

event,"

Aries: There can be major upsets in love this weekend! Partnerships experience all sorts of stress from outside forces! With Mercury now retrograde you will have to very careful the way to speak to your loved one. Sensitive feelings are strong! Be prepared to walk on egg shells this weekend!
column2: (what the..... haha, k i'll be careful)

column5: He likes to experiment a lot with his cooking so everything he makes is a pleasant surprise.&nbsp

column1: event,"My boyfriend and I enjoy spending time at the Silo, sitting upstairs eating our lunch.  Once we are done, we chillax up there, checking out all the women that walk by beneath us =P.  Actually we do that everywhere we go...mall, restaurants, and even the library! haha  Yes, beware ladies...we're probably watching you! hahaha.  So far we've agreed on how hot/fugly most of them look.  Today we couldn't help but notice this girl walking up the stairs with a really big rack.  Unfortunately, upclose they did not look so nice...sagggy boobs are not attractive!  This makes me feel somewhat better about my petite boobs...I mean, there's nothing to sag! HAHAHA =P He says I'm a great girlfriend cuz I check out other girls with him haha. Thanks?? =P But I think it's time he be a good bf and start checking out the guys with me! Com'on, it's only fair!!!"

column2: You should know what the book is about based on the title
column3: -) . So maybe you already know (well I sure didn't, but then again I'm pretty uninformed about the male species and what I know are stuff my bf tells me haha) that being a fat lazy ass who smokes and treating ur body like trash will make your little friend well ...little....and soft...and...u get the point.&nbsp
column4: So spare yourself from having the penis of a fifty year old man, go exercise and eat well.&nbsp
column5: The hardness of your penis can determine how healthy you are and vice versa haha.&nbsp

column1: Best part of the show...he broke out with this device called the Rigidometer.
column2: So the point is to stick your excited friend in it, hold for five seconds, and it measures the hardness.&nbsp
column3: Nifty little thing...I want one, not that I have any use for it.&nbsp
column4: But I can stick anything in it and it'll measure the hardness haha.....shut up, I'm not weird!&nbsp
column5: So Conan stuck his thingie in and the reading was 500.&nbsp
column6: The average measurement for a 15 yr. old guy (usally the age where it's the hardest it can be) is somewhere around 2000.&nbsp
column7: Yea he's older, but 500???? Uh oh Conan.....

column1: I'm kidding, it was his finger that he inserted in the Rigidometer.
column2: It was late night T.V., not porn!!!&nbsp

column1: Anywho, to go off on a tangent,
column5: I wish I was a guy, then there would be so much more motivation to work out =P.&nbsp

event,"

Bad bad news....the Vietnam trip is probably not gonna happen anymore =(. I guess it's for the best. Oh well,maybe in september or next summer...

The past few days have been really fun! Phan came to visit so we did a lot of random stuff like renting a really bad movie, eating Ciocolat in the park with no lights, bought fabric because we're ambitious ppl who think we can sew our own clothes, hung out at Fry's haha, and ate lots of yummy food like cake, baked jello (yes, we ""baked"" jello =P) Fuji's buffet, Cafe Italia, Thai2K, and Chevy's (yummy watermelon margarita ^_^).
column2: I was supposed to drive her back Friday night, but since my awesome Biomedical Engineering classmates wanted to go rafting, Phan stayed til saturday so she could join in on the fun.&nbsp
column3: Bobby also stayed instead of going home for the weekend&nbsp
column5: After rafting, Bobby and I drove her back to Berkeley&nbsp
column6: and we had Steve's Korean BBQ again! *droooling*&nbsp
column7: And of course we ended the night with 5 episodes of 24 Season 4 =).&nbsp
column8: This season is by far the best!&nbsp

column1: ~I just ordered this ^_^ This came out in 2004, how come I didn't know about it??? I love J, she's got such soulful voice! Gonna add it to my collection haha =).
You are attracted to those who are unbridled, untrammeled, and free.
In love, you feel the most alive when your partner is patient and never willing to give up on you.
You'd like to your lover to think you are optimistic and happy.
You would be forced to break up with someone who was emotional, moody, and difficult to please.
Your ideal relationship is lasting. You want a relationship that looks to the future... one you can grow with.
Your risk of cheating is zero. You care about society and morality. You would never break a commitment.
You think of marriage as something that will confine you. You are afraid of marriage.
In this moment, you think of love as something you thirst for. You'll do anything for love, but you won't fall for it easily.
What Are The Keys To Your Heart?
